subject: Re: [junit] really stupid question
msgSnippet: Then I would guess that your CLASSPATH doesn t have junit.samples.money.MoneyTest in it.  Make sure that MoneyTest compiled successfully, and that the parent
messageBody:
Then I would guess that your CLASSPATH doesn't have
junit.samples.money.MoneyTest in it. Make sure that MoneyTest compiled
successfully, and that the parent directory of junit(.samples...) is in your
CLASSPATH before launching the TestRunner.

Thanks,

_chas_

> From: "Choe, Mike" <mchoe@...>
> To: <junit@yahoogroups.com>
> Sent: Tuesday, March 27, 2001 12:30 PM
> Subject: RE: [junit] really stupid question
>
> yes.
> i typed in the package name as well: junit.samples.money.MoneyTest
>

> this is strange.
>
> thanks for your help Chas.
>
> -mike
>
